title: Chicago Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses Ordinance

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Chicago Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses Ordinance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past five years (Nov. 2022–present) regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance" in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses" as described in Sec. 8-4-090 in Chicago's city code.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance
• written notices from the authorized representatives of the city to the owner or controller of the premises identifying nuisances and abatement measures
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
•fines and penalties collected for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
• information regarding any court actions related thereto, including motions for court orders to place a property into receivership or condemnation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Jenny Wadhwa, 
 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Chicago Public Records Portal. 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, we are excited to share with you that you can now submit FOIA requests through a newly implemented online request system. While you will still be allowed to email your FOIA requests, creating an account and submitting your request online will allow you to check the online portal for the status of requests. You will also receive an email when the records are ready to be downloaded. 
 
Please click here to visit our (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HQBImk7-2Bynhw89FmPm6yuaWsC4gmpg-2FhBMj-2BboHFqhgYdax__kznKCPUNKBWhJt8vmYWWMT-2BbKdjUNKWyVNNky47j-2FiVC7zvLENcUjKf-2BTR9oE3tLMeqTA7qTf1rZFjkK1GvsDCyzVgAuoibsZsLFO0MtGmYJaVp8W4Sc7iwLOmB-2B-2Fi8lavFF1q0KG6QQjMAimijM-2Fqx67RKm-2BFvzdt1-2BJyiGX-2FqoJORTVH3JLA0kFTJX7-2FUgKJle1aG9IfJhAGGu3PoOYXq9vN1UlpV5nG-2Ft4ecI0oo-3D) Chicago Public Records portal! If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password, please request a Temporary Password using the Forgot Password option on the login screen. 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: P898410-112823
communications.communication:
Dear Jenny: 
 
Thank you for your interest in information from the Chicago Police Department. Your FOIA request has been received and is being processed. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: P898410-112823 
You have requested the following records: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past five years (Nov. 2022–present) regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance" in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses" as described in Sec. 8-4-090 in Chicago's city code.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the ordinance
• written notices from the authorized representatives of the city to the owner or controller of the premises identifying nuisances and abatement measures
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
•fines and penalties collected for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
• information regarding any court actions related thereto, including motions for court orders to place a property into receivership or condemnation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-police-department-503%252Fchicago-drug-and-gang-houses-houses-of-prostitution-and-other-disorderly-houses-ordinance-155255%252F%253Femail%253Dfoia%252540chicagopolice.org&url_auth_token=AAAjxjuRDDPTwl_GecEA7eveYKE%3A1r8C61%3Aj4PVLcrHVARAx6vHAU7e9z-HtKbyuw9Lsxftxf_GGh8 
Chicago Police Department (CPD) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.  If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the Chicago FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Barry Gordon Croft, Jr.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer,
I am writing to formally request information related to the Governor Gretchen Whitmer Kidnapping plot case and Barry Gordon Croft, Jr for the purpose of journalistic inquiry and reporting. Specifically, I am seeking access to any and all documents, records, and communications related to this case, including but not limited to:
1. Investigative reports
2. Interview transcripts
3. Surveillance footage
4. Court documents
5. Correspondence with other government agencies
6. Internal emails, memos, and communications discussing the case
7. Any other relevant information or evidence
8. Internal emails, memos, and communications discussing the case or Mr. Croft specifically from Special Agent John Penrod and Special Agent Kristopher Long 

To assist in narrowing the search, I kindly request that the timeframe of the request covers all relevant information from the inception of the case (April 2019) to the present day from the FBI's Baltimore Field Office. 
I understand that fees may apply for processing this request, and I am willing to cover reasonable costs. However, I am requesting a fee waiver if the requested information is in the public interest and its disclosure serves to inform the public.
As a journalist, I am committed to providing accurate and in-depth reporting to the public, and I believe that access to this information will contribute to the public's understanding of this case and the actions of government agencies involved.
Please consider this FOIA request and respond within the statutory timeframes outlined in the FOIA. If you require any clarification or have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at the email address or phone number provided above.
Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to your prompt response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christina L. Urso

communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I understand that fees may apply for processing this request, and I am
    willing to cover reasonable costs. However, I am requesting a fee waiver if
    the requested information is in the public interest and its disclosure
    serves to inform the public.
    As a journalist, I am committed to providing accurate and in-depth reporting
    to the public, and I believe that access to this information will contribute
    to the public's understanding of this case and the actions of government
    agencies involved.

Documentation Files

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Dear FOIA Officer,
    I am writing to formally request information related to the Governor
    Gretchen Whitmer Kidnapping plot case and Barry Gordon Croft, Jr for the
    purpose of journalistic inquiry and reporting. Specifically, I am seeking
    access to any and all documents, records, and communications related to this
    case, including but not limited to:
    1. Investigative reports
    2. Interview transcripts
    3. Surveillance footage
    4. Court documents
    5. Correspondence with other government agencies
    6. Internal emails, memos, and communications discussing the case
    7. Any other relevant information or evidence
    8. Internal emails, memos, and communications discussing the case or Mr.
    Croft specifically from Special Agent John Penrod and Special Agent
    Kristopher Long
    
    To assist in narrowing the search, I kindly request that the timeframe of
    the request covers all relevant information from the inception of the case
    (April 2019) to the present day from the FBI's Baltimore Field Office.
    I understand that fees may apply for processing this request, and I am
    willing to cover reasonable costs. However, I am requesting a fee waiver if
    the requested information is in the public interest and its disclosure
    serves to inform the public.
    As a journalist, I am committed to providing accurate and in-depth reporting
    to the public, and I believe that access to this information will contribute
    to the public's understanding of this case and the actions of government
    agencies involved.
    Please consider this FOIA request and respond within the statutory
    timeframes outlined in the FOIA. If you require any clarification or have
    any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at the email address or
    phone number provided above.
    Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to your
    prompt response.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Christina L. Urso

**

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: New Request Certified Jailers and Police Officers McLennan County Texas Cost of Housing Prisoners (McLennan County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: New Request Certified Jailers and Police Officers McLennan County Texas Cost of Housing Prisoners (McLennan County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Tuesday November 28th, 2023

1. All records showing the number of CERTIFIED JAILERS Employed 
January the 1st 2018 until December 31st, 2018
January the 1st 2019 until December 31st, 2019, to include the takeover of the Jack Harwell Detention Center in September 2019
January the 1st 2020 until December 31st, 2020
January the 1st 2021 until December 31st, 2021
January the 1st 2022 until December 31st, 2022
January the 1st 2023 until October 20, 2023

2. A list of all CERTIFIED POLICE OFFICERS that have quit or resigned from 01/01/2013 to the present. 

3. All records showing the number of federal inmates housed/incarcerated at McLennan County and the Jack Harwell Detention Center for the years 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023. All documented income and/or loss of income from housing federal inmates. 

4. All records showing the number of County Inmates housed/incarcerated in McLennan County Jail for the years 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023. All documented costs of housing County inmates per year. 

5. All documents to include the McLennan County Duty Logbook showing employees that have been assigned to work the front guard gate at the McLennan County Jail for the time period of October 1, 2022, through October 1, 2023. Again, no specific dates or times are required.

6. All documents showing employees assigned to guard incarcerated inmates who have been admitted into the hospital or transported to doctors’ appointments outside the McLennan County Jail from October 1, 2022, to October 1, 2023. Again, no specific dates or times are required.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available, or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.
Sincerely,
Bernadette Feazell

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

communications.subject: Welcome to the Open Records Request Portal!
communications.communication:
Dear Bernadette Feazell, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Open Records Request Portal. 
 
Your Login ID is:  155204-51339344@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request.

communications.subject: Welcome to the Open Records Request Portal!
communications.communication:
Dear Bernadette Feazell, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Open Records Request Portal. 
 
Your Login ID is:  155206-94094233@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HQD5Ni-2BjRYLEWACoSf8-2FgUYIFVkZu6jLgMYnrFjhxKIkoLeHYqe1oEd0w0wxfiuxMedkwX2TV4Z9wntaA6uW4JA-3D7Pax_-2BUXvfpQe59GMilxLAJ9V0K-2BEaW2UcUCde7syHbpU4S-2Ba7B4wuz0QicuHD6DqySBmdSiJzY829OLDh7h7WvZN7Ri4RjBhi4Lte-2B-2BQHpg95d31NX-2BNO4DlYhhr7Sxxmlp4xOZWNfPKar35rf-2BpHVHqybDhXKVRGMINaBJ2-2FmQMYlwKY1-2BKPoqTBXtb3eindhgx5NIP1qHLGt74d98MviomFpLCl3eYjDGPwAlxCXXb71U-3D) 
 
Please login to My Records Center to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HQD5Ni-2BjRYLEWACoSf8-2FgUYIFVkZu6jLgMYnrFjhxKIk3uOjHSo-2FUs7l9MvNLfuOLH48BjErWYTCYGMeBeWnyT0-3DFL4Y_-2BUXvfpQe59GMilxLAJ9V0K-2BEaW2UcUCde7syHbpU4S-2Ba7B4wuz0QicuHD6DqySBmdSiJzY829OLDh7h7WvZN7cA93g6gUeNvo7rVUvLuhnwO-2FA0gq5VifsX4eHwRxHrp2fSK9HLPfCe9rsm8UyovHXjYCwaObWzediSYi6bNs2Sv8BtRw3lL3rqWakDjDZZeZbsD4twI-2FZifPxwfQONKYFWmcCz16cf-2BNiJ2C21glx8-3D)

communications.subject: Sheriff's Office Records Request :: R003462-112823
communications.communication:
Dear Bernadette Feazell: 
Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 11/28/2023 and given the reference number R003462-112823 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Tuesday November 28th, 2023

1. All records showing the number of CERTIFIED JAILERS Employed
January the 1st 2018 until December 31st, 2018
January the 1st 2019 until December 31st, 2019, to include the takeover of the Jack Harwell Detention Center in September 2019
January the 1st 2020 until December 31st, 2020
January the 1st 2021 until December 31st, 2021
January the 1st 2022 until December 31st, 2022
January the 1st 2023 until October 20, 2023

2. A list of all CERTIFIED POLICE OFFICERS that have quit or resigned from 01/01/2013 to the present.

3. All records showing the number of federal inmates housed/incarcerated at McLennan County and the Jack Harwell Detention Center for the years 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023. All documented income and/or loss of income from housing federal inmates.

4. All records showing the number of County Inmates housed/incarcerated in McLennan County Jail for the years 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023. All documented costs of housing County inmates per year.

5. All documents to include the McLennan County Duty Logbook showing employees that have been assigned to work the front guard gate at the McLennan County Jail for the time period of October 1, 2022, through October 1, 2023. Again, no specific dates or times are required.

6. All documents showing employees assigned to guard incarcerated inmates who have been admitted into the hospital or transported to doctors’ appointments outside the McLennan County Jail from October 1, 2022, to October 1, 2023. Again, no specific dates or times are required.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available, or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.
Sincerely,
Bernadette Feazell

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fmclennan-county-administrator-justin-chapman-33169%252Fnew-request-certified-jailers-and-police-officers-mclennan-county-texas-cost-of-housing-prisoners-mclennan-county-administrator-justin-chapman-155206%252F%253Femail%253Ddustin.chapman%252540co.mclennan.tx.us&url_auth_token=AAF2prKhKqMp_aO8P-PB-csJUhM%3A1r8ByS%3A_9ABzkn-j_kanKDq_Rq7dkbu6EmnSHBchLaQ4ok9sts 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
McLennan County Sheriff's Office

title: New Request Certified Jailers and Police Officers McLennan County Texas Cost of Housing Prisoners (Mclennan County Auditor's Office)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: New Request Certified Jailers and Police Officers McLennan County Texas Cost of Housing Prisoners (Mclennan County Auditor's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Tuesday November 28th, 2023

1. All records showing the number of CERTIFIED JAILERS Employed 
January the 1st 2018 until December 31st, 2018
January the 1st 2019 until December 31st, 2019, to include the takeover of the Jack Harwell Detention Center in September 2019
January the 1st 2020 until December 31st, 2020
January the 1st 2021 until December 31st, 2021
January the 1st 2022 until December 31st, 2022
January the 1st 2023 until October 20, 2023

2. A list of all CERTIFIED POLICE OFFICERS that have quit or resigned from 01/01/2013 to the present. 

3. All records showing the number of federal inmates housed/incarcerated at McLennan County and the Jack Harwell Detention Center for the years 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023. All documented income and/or loss of income from housing federal inmates. 

4. All records showing the number of County Inmates housed/incarcerated in McLennan County Jail for the years 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023. All documented costs of housing County inmates per year. 

5. All documents to include the McLennan County Duty Logbook showing employees that have been assigned to work the front guard gate at the McLennan County Jail for the time period of October 1, 2022, through October 1, 2023. Again, no specific dates or times are required.

6. All documents showing employees assigned to guard incarcerated inmates who have been admitted into the hospital or transported to doctors’ appointments outside the McLennan County Jail from October 1, 2022, to October 1, 2023. Again, no specific dates or times are required.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available, or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.
Sincerely,
Bernadette Feazell

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

title: Amended Request For Time Records (McLennan County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Amended Request For Time Records (McLennan County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Tuesday November 28th, 2023

I am NOT requesting any specific dates, or specific time, information. I am requesting just the NUMBER of hours per week spent at each location listed and for each employee listed for the date ranges listed below.

McLennan County has the ability to obtain and provide this information from the following: Magnetic Swipe logs for, Thomas Parnell McNamara, Chris Eubank, Rebecca Eubank, and Cody Blossman for 901 Washington, Hwy 6 Jail and Jack Harwell Detention Center

Sign In Logs for, Thomas Parnell McNamara, Chris Eubank, Rebecca Eubank, and Cody Blossman for 901 Washington, Hwy 6 Jail and Jack Harwell Detention Center

and any other record-keeping methods of physical presence or time spent at 901 Washington or Hwy 6 Jail and Jack Harwell Detention Center

during each weekly period for the following yearly periods.
January the 1st 2013 until December 31st, 2013
January the 1st 2014 until December 31st, 2014
January the 1st 2015 until December 31st, 2015
January the 1st 2016 until December 31st, 2016
January the 1st 2017 until December 31st, 2017
January the 1st 2018 until December 31st, 2018
January the 1st 2019 until December 31st, 2019, to include the takeover of the Jack Harwell Detention Center in September 2019
January the 1st 2020 until December 31st, 2020
January the 1st 2021 until December 31st, 2021
January the 1st 2022 until December 31st, 2022
January the 1st 2023 until November 28th, 2023

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Bernadette Feazell

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell
